definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: Zola takes, Cordoba heads clear at the far post.
sentences.chinese: 对方角球，佐拉主罚，科尔多巴在远端头取解围。

sentences.english: We have a handful of players who can take free-kicks but he's definitely staked a claim to take the next one.
sentences.chinese: 我们有很多能踢任意球的人，但他主动要求主罚。

sentences.english: He kicked a penalty goal in the football match.
sentences.chinese: 在这场足球赛中，他主罚，踢进了一个球。

sentences.english: Ina competition, Chilavert usually kick foul shots and free kicks.
sentences.chinese: 在比赛中，奇拉维特经常主罚点球和任意球。

sentences.english: One very simple indicator of the ability of a player is whether he takes set-pieces.
sentences.chinese: 判断球员能力的一个简单指标就是他是否主罚定位球。

sentences.english: I did an awful lot of research on who takes penalties for Spurs.
sentences.chinese: 我在热刺有谁可能来主罚点球的问题上做了很多研究。

sentences.english: The winning goal was from one of his superbly struck corners.
sentences.chinese: 致胜一球是来自他主罚的一个漂亮角球。

definition: corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
to knock on the door/to take a shot on goal (sports)
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
to set up a teammate (with an opportunity to score)/to throw a game
(sports) to extend the duration of a game (due to stoppages)/(abbr. for 傷停補時|伤停补时[shang1 ting2 bu3 shi2]) injury time
